item.title: Systemadministrator / IT- Consultant (m/w/d)
item.description:
We are currently looking for an experienced System Administrator / IT Consultant (m/f/d) to support the team of one of our important customers. The position is a permanent position.

Tasks

  • Ensuring the operation of business and process IT
  • Planning, installing, and administering high-availability virtualization and server systems, storage environments, and IT infrastructures
  • Installing and configuring new servers, systems, and software
  • Participating in strategy, innovation, digitization, and change projects
  • Technical design of interfaces between technical applications in business and process IT and other departments

Profile

  • Successfully completed training in the IT field or degree in information technology, computer science, or a comparable field
  • Several years of professional experience in system administration and working with complex IT infrastructures
  • Ideally, knowledge and experience in the area of IT security and firewall administration
  • Experience in IT project and process management
  • Knowledge in the field of virtualization environments, storage networks, and the Microsoft Windows Active Directory environment as well as Microsoft 365
  • Knowledge in the terminal server environment and knowledge in the Citrix environment desirable

Requirements

  • Strong teamwork and communication skills
  • Professional and friendly manner
  • High degree of initiative and motivation
  • Independent, solution-oriented, and structured approach to work
  • Customer- and service-oriented thinking and acting
  • Class B driver’s license
  • Fluency in German is required

General conditions

  • Start date: Immediately
  • Location: Westerstede – office, field work, and up to 70% remote.
  • Salary range: 50,000 - 72,000 euros

Benefits

  • Work in an interesting customer environment
  • Continuous training and development
  • A collegial and respectful working atmosphere with an open culture of communication and flat hierarchies
  • Work in a young, qualified, and committed team
  • Performance-based remuneration

Interested?

Then apply directly HERE with your resume!

We look forward to getting to know you better and talking to you about your new job.

item.title: Your new job as a Sales B2B Outbound (m/f/d)
item.description:
For our growing remote IT consulting company we are looking for a “B2B Outbound Sales Representative” with fire under the butt and personality on the phone.

If you are passionate about sales, can identify with technology, cloud and software development and want to develop yourself extremely, then join our team.

uRemoTech is a 100% remote IT consulting company from Schleswig-Holstein. We are passionate about advancing our customers throughout Germany in the areas of software development and cloud.

In recent years, we have worked successfully with well-known companies such as Bertelsmann, Daimler and Otto.

With immediate effect, we are specifically looking for full-time reinforcement in the Cold Calling team, for a remote position.

Why you should definitely become a part of uRemoTech:

  • You sell real added value for our customers → Technology is at the heart of every company.
  • You work independently in a great team.
  • Strong personal growth through internal training.
  • You are in control of your own income.
  • You have good promotion opportunities with strong performance.
  • We are an ambitious company with a great vision.
  • You have flexible working arrangements thanks to our remote culture.
  • A MacBook to work with, because we know how important a good work tool is.
  • Permanent permanent position.

What you need to bring to the table:

  • 1-2 years experience in sales, ideally in customer acquisition.
  • Full-time availability.
  • Communicative personality on the phone.
  • Structured way of working.
  • Determination, personal responsibility and the ability to work according to key figures.
  • Ability to follow existing processes.
  • Motivation and positive minimum.
  • German at native speaker level.
  • nice to have: Experience in IT sales.

Your tasks:

  • You are responsible for the acquisition of new customers.
  • Arrangement of initial meetings by telephone.

Our goal:

Our goal is to help our clients navigate the technological landscape and together pave the way for their sustainable success. We achieve this by implementing individual software projects and providing IT consultants for existing projects.

We want to set a new benchmark in the market and give all companies out there the opportunity to utilize their full digital potential in a tailor-made way.

We work every day to become the most modern, innovative and fastest-growing IT consultancy, unrivaled in progress and technological excellence.

Interested?

Then apply directly HERE with your resume!

We look forward to getting to know you better and talking to you about your new job.

item.title: IT Consultant – Backend Developer (m/f/d)
item.description:
For our growing company we are looking for an IT consultant with fire under the butt. If you are as passionate about software development as we are and want to continuously develop yourself, then join our team.

uRemoTech is a 100% remote IT consulting company based near Kiel in Schleswig-Holstein. We are burning to help clients across Germany move forward in DevOps, Cloud and Software Development. In the past years we have worked with well-known companies like Bertelsmann, Daimler or Otto.

Starting immediately, we are looking for an experienced IT consultant with a focus on backend development in full-time, for a remote position.
As part of our team, you will contribute to the design and implementation of different software architectures for our customers. In doing so, you will bring your individual language skills to the table.

You have fun doing:

  • Design and implementation of backends.
  • Agile software development.
  • Software architecture and development.
  • Microservice architectures.
  • Docker or cloud, if applicable.
  • Collaborate with other consultants and developers to find the best solutions for our clients.
  • Familiarizing yourself with new topics to constantly expand your knowledge.

Ideally, you bring with you:

  • Several years of work experience as a backend developer, architect or in a similar role.
  • Good knowledge of development tools and practices such as architecture, programming, testing, APIs, security, etc.
  • At least 3 years of experience in a widely used programming language (e.g. Java, C#, NodeJS, Python, Golang, etc.).
  • Ideally experience with Docker and cloud.
  • Good communication skills and customer focus.
  • Willingness to work in home office or At the location of your choice.
  • Very good German and good English skills.

What we offer you:

  • The opportunity to develop yourself and your skills and work on interesting projects.
  • Continuing education in the form of training and conferences.
  • A MacBook to work with, because we know how important a good work device is.
  • The flexibility and independence of a remote position.
  • An attractive salary.
  • 30 days of vacation.

Interested?

Then apply directly HERE with your resume!

We look forward to getting to know you better and talking to you about your new job.

item.title: IT Consultant – Cloud Engineer (m/f/d)
item.description:
For our growing company we are looking for an IT consultant with fire under the butt. If you are as passionate about cloud infrastructure as we are and want to continuously develop yourself, then join our team.

uRemoTech is a 100% remote IT consulting company based near Kiel in Schleswig-Holstein. We are burning to help clients across Germany move forward in DevOps, Cloud and Software Development. In the past years we have worked with well-known companies like Bertelsmann, Daimler or Otto.

Starting immediately, we are looking for an experienced IT consultant with a focus on “Cloud Engineering” in full-time, for a remote position.
As part of our team, you will help support our clients on a variety of cloud-related topics and improve the effectiveness and quality of their development and operations processes.

You have fun doing:

  • Dealing with the 3 major public clouds.
  • Building and monitoring cloud landscapes.
  • Monitoring existing infrastructure.
  • You are no stranger to IaC (Infrastructure as Code).
  • Planning and implementing cloud migrations.
  • Dealing with Docker, Kubernetes and cloud.
  • Collaborating with other consultants and developers to find the best solutions for our customers.
  • Familiarizing yourself with new topics to constantly expand your knowledge.

Ideally, you bring with you:

  • Several years of work experience as a Cloud Engineer or in a similar role.
  • Good knowledge of cloud tools and practices such as Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD), Infrastructure as Code, GitOps, Monitoring, etc.
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and at least one of the 3 major cloud providers.
  • Good communication skills and customer focus.
  • Willingness to work in home office or At the location of your choice.
  • Very good German and good English skills.

What we offer you:

  • The opportunity to develop yourself and your skills and work on interesting projects.
  • Continuing education in the form of training and conferences.
  • A MacBook to work with, because we know how important a good work device is.
  • The flexibility and independence of a remote position.
  • An attractive salary.
  • 30 days of vacation.

Interested?

Then apply directly HERE with your resume!

We look forward to getting to know you better and talking to you about your new job.

item.title: IT Consultant – DevOps Engineer (m/f/d)
item.description:
For our growing company we are looking for an IT consultant with fire under the butt. If you are as passionate about DevOps as we are and want to continuously develop yourself, then join our team.

uRemoTech is a 100% remote IT consulting company based near Kiel in Schleswig-Holstein. We are burning to help clients across Germany move forward in DevOps, Cloud and Software Development. In the past years we have worked with well-known companies like Bertelsmann, Daimler or Otto.

Starting immediately, we are looking for an experienced IT consultant with a focus on DevOps in full-time, for a remote position.
As part of our team, you will contribute to helping our customers adopt DevOps practices and tools and improve the effectiveness and quality of their development and operations processes.

You have fun doing:

  • Designing and building build and release processes with CI/CD.
  • Transition from DevOps to GitOps.
  • Planning and implementing cloud migrations.
  • Monitoring and automation of customer environments.
  • Working with Docker and Kubernetes, ideally cloud.
  • Collaborating with other consultants and developers to find the best solutions for our customers.
  • Familiarizing yourself with new topics to constantly expand your knowledge.

Ideally, you bring with you:

  • Several years of professional experience as DevOps or in a similar role.
  • Good knowledge of DevOps tools and practices such as Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD), Infrastructure as Code, GitOps, monitoring, etc.
  • Experience with Docker and Kubernetes, ideally cloud.
  • Good communication skills and customer focus.
  • Willingness to work in home office or At the location of your choice.
  • Very good German and good English skills.

What we offer you:

  • The opportunity to develop yourself and your skills and work on interesting projects.
  • Continuing education in the form of training and conferences.
  • A MacBook to work with, because we know how important a good work device is.
  • The flexibility and independence of a remote position.
  • An attractive salary.
  • 30 days of vacation.
  • Optional: company car, or JobRad.

Interested?

Then apply directly HERE with your resume!

We look forward to getting to know you better and talking to you about your new job.

item.title: IT Consultant – Full-Stack Developer (m/f/d)

For our growing company we are looking for an IT consultant with fire under the butt. If you are as passionate about software development as we are and want to continuously develop yourself, then join our team.

uRemoTech is a 100% remote IT consulting company based near Kiel in Schleswig-Holstein. We are burning to help clients across Germany move forward in DevOps, Cloud and Software Development. In the past years we have worked with well-known companies like Bertelsmann, Daimler or Otto.

item.title: Privacy
item.description:
Disclaimer This page is an English translation provided for convenience only.
The original German version is legally binding.

The person responsible within the meaning of the data protection laws, in particular the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), is:

uRemoTech GmbH & Co. KG

Your data subject rights

You can exercise the following rights at any time using the contact details provided for our data protection officer:

  • Information about your data stored by us and their processing (Article 15 GDPR),
  • Correction of incorrect personal data (Article 16 GDPR),
  • Deletion of your data stored by us (Article 17 GDPR),
  • Restriction of data processing if we are not yet allowed to delete your data due to legal obligations (Article 18 GDPR),
  • Objection to the processing of your data by us (Article 21 GDPR) and
  • Data transferability if you have consented to data processing or have concluded a contract with us (Article 20 GDPR). If you have given us your consent, you can revoke this at any time with effect for the future.

You can contact a supervisory authority at any time with a complaint, e.g. B. to the competent supervisory authority of the federal state of your place of residence or to the authority responsible for us as the responsible body.

A list of the supervisory authorities (for the non-public area) with addresses can be found at: https://www.bfdi.bund.de/DE/Service/Anschriften/Laender/Laender-node.html.

contact form

Type and purpose of processing

The data you enter will be stored for the purpose of individual communication with you. This requires you to provide a valid email address and your name. This is used to allocate the request and then to answer it. Providing further data is optional.

Legal basis

The data entered in the contact form is processed on the basis of a legitimate interest (Article 6 (1) (f) GDPR).

By providing the contact form, we would like to make it easy for you to contact us. The information you provide will be stored for the purpose of processing the request and for possible follow-up questions.

If you contact us to request an offer, the data entered in the contact form will be processed to carry out pre-contractual measures (Article 6 (1) (b) GDPR).

Recipient

Recipients of the data may be processors.

Storage duration

Data will be deleted no later than 6 months after processing the request.

If there is a contractual relationship, we are subject to the statutory retention periods according to the German Commercial Code and delete your data after these periods have expired.

Provision prescribed or required

The provision of your personal data is voluntary. However, we can only process your request if you provide us with your name, email address and the reason for the request.

Use of Google Analytics

If you have given your consent, this website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service provided by Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043 USA (hereinafter: “Google”). Google Analytics uses “cookies”, which are text files placed on your computer, to help the website analyze how users use the site. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website is usually transmitted to a Google server in the USA and stored there. However, due to the activation of IP anonymization on these web pages, your IP address will be truncated beforehand by Google within member states of the European Union or in other contracting states of the Agreement on the European Economic Area. Only in exceptional cases will the full IP address be transmitted to a Google server in the USA and shortened there. The IP address transmitted by your browser as part of Google Analytics will not be merged with other data from Google.

For more information on terms of use and data protection, please visit https://www.google.com/analytics/terms/de.html and https://policies.google.com/?hl=de.

On behalf of the operator of this website, Google will use this information for the purpose of evaluating your use of the website, compiling reports on website activity and providing other services relating to website activity and internet usage to the website operator.

The data sent by us and linked to cookies, user IDs (e.g. user ID) or advertising IDs are automatically deleted after 14 months. The deletion of data whose retention period has been reached takes place automatically once a month.

Revocation of consent:

You can stop tracking by Google Analytics on our website by clicking this link. This will install an opt-out cookie on your device. This will prevent the collection by Google Analytics for this website and for this browser in the future, as long as the cookie remains installed in your browser.

You can also prevent the storage of cookies by selecting the appropriate settings on your browser software; however, please note that in this case you may not be able to use the full functionality of this website.

You can also prevent the collection of data generated by the cookie and related to your use of the website (including your IP address) to Google and the processing of this data by Google by downloading and installing the browser plugin available at the following link: Browser Add On to disable Google Analytics.

Use of script libraries (Google Webfonts)

In order to display our content correctly and graphically appealing across browsers, we use “Google Web Fonts” from Google LLC (1600 Amphitheater Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA; hereinafter “Google”) to display fonts on this website.

You can find more information about Google Web Fonts at https://developers.google.com/fonts/faq and in Google’s privacy policy: https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/.

SSL encryption

In order to protect the security of your data during transmission, we use state-of-the-art encryption methods (e.g. SSL) via HTTPS.

Information about your right of objection according to Art. 21 GDPR

Individual right of objection

You have the right, for reasons arising from your particular situation, to object at any time to the processing of personal data relating to you, which is based on Article 6 (1) (f) GDPR (data processing on the basis of a balance of interests); this also applies to profiling based on this provision within the meaning of Art. 4 No. 4 GDPR.

If you file an objection, we will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for processing that outweigh your interests, rights and freedoms, or the processing serves to assert, exercise or defend legal claims.

Recipient of an objection

Change to our privacy policy

We reserve the right to adapt this data protection declaration so that it always corresponds to the current legal requirements or to implement changes to our services in the data protection declaration, e.g. when introducing new services. The new data protection declaration will then apply to your next visit.

Questions to the data protection officer

If you have any questions about data protection, please send us an email or contact the person responsible for data protection in our organization directly: Lennart Röder

item.title: Terms
item.description:
Disclaimer This page is an English translation provided for convenience only.
The original German version is legally binding.

General Terms and Conditions (GTC) of uRemoTech GmbH & Co. KG

for direct placement and project deployment of project personnel (B2B) – version date: 2025-08-23

1. Scope and Incorporation

1.1 These GTC apply vis-à-vis entrepreneurs (Section 14 BGB) to (a) the direct placement of candidates for permanent employment and (b) the project deployment of project personnel at the customer.

1.2 The GTC become part of the contract if uRemoTech refers to them in the offer (link/PDF) and the customer accepts the offer. Deviating terms of the customer do not apply without uRemoTech’s express consent in text form.

1.3 The version of the GTC linked in the offer, with its version date, applies. uRemoTech archives previous versions.

2. Definitions

“Introduction” means any transmission or naming of a candidate/project-personnel profile by uRemoTech—regardless of the communication channel.

“Project personnel” are uRemoTech’s own employees or contractually engaged specialists.

“Affiliated companies” are those within the meaning of Section 15 of the German Stock Corporation Act (AktG).

3. uRemoTech’s Services

3.1 Identification, interviews, and introduction of suitable candidates/project personnel according to the customer’s requirements.

3.2 Suitability check based on candidate-provided information; an in-depth verification (e.g., authenticity of qualifications) is not owed.

3.3 No particular placement or project success is owed. uRemoTech also makes no warranty regarding a candidate’s qualifications.

4. Customer Duties / Non-Disclosure to Third Parties

4.1 The customer shall inform uRemoTech without undue delay, but no later than within 7 days of receipt, if an introduced candidate/project personnel is already known. Any objection on the grounds of prior knowledge is excluded after this period.

4.2 Profiles/information may not be passed on to third parties without uRemoTech’s prior consent; the same applies to affiliated companies.

5. Direct Placement (Permanent Employment)

5.1 Fee Accrual. The fee base (amount exclusively as per the offer) arises upon conclusion of an employment contract between the customer (or a third party after onward transfer/affiliated company) and the introduced candidate.

5.2 Tail Period. If within 12 months after the most recent introduction a contract with the introduced candidate is concluded—whether as permanent employment, service/work contract, employee leasing, or any other engagement—this is deemed facilitated by uRemoTech and is subject to the fee as per the offer; this also applies where engagement occurs via affiliated companies or third parties.

5.3 Anti-Circumvention and Liquidated Damages. Prohibited in particular are (i) onward transfer of profiles followed by engagement/hiring, (ii) contracting via intermediaries, affiliated companies, or related third parties, (iii) changing the contract model within the tail period. For violations, the customer owes liquidated damages equal to the fee that would have accrued under the most recent uRemoTech offer in the case of proper engagement; proof of higher or lower damages remains reserved.

5.4 Invoicing & Due Date. Invoicing after the customer’s notification of contract and key terms; payment term 14 days net; statutory default rules (Sections 286, 288 BGB) apply.

6. Project Deployment of Project Personnel (Service Agreement with uRemoTech)

6.1 Contract Model. The customer concludes the service/project agreement exclusively with uRemoTech; the project personnel has no contractual relationship with the customer. Project details (performance/time records, invoicing, payment terms, cooperation) are governed solely by the service agreement/offer.

6.2 Non-Solicitation/Anti-Circumvention. The customer undertakes not to enter into direct contracts with the deployed project personnel during the ongoing project and for 12 months thereafter, and not to arrange circumvention via third parties. In case of breach, the customer owes liquidated damages equal to the lost project revenue, but at least the daily rate for 30 project days; proof of higher or lower damages remains reserved.

7. Information and Verification Duties

The customer shall inform uRemoTech without undue delay in text form of the conclusion and key terms of contracts/engagements with introduced persons. To verify compliance with these GTC, uRemoTech may, where there is a specific reason, request inspection of objectively necessary, appropriate, and proportionate evidence (e.g., engagement/employment confirmations, anonymized deployment records). The customer’s trade and business secrets remain protected.

8. Liability

Intent/gross negligence: unlimited. In cases of slight negligence, liability arises only for breach of essential contractual duties and is limited to typical, foreseeable damages; indirect damages/lost profits are excluded. Unaffected: product liability and injury to life, body, or health; applies also in favor of legal representatives/vicarious agents.
The limitation period for defect and damage claims is 12 months from the date the defect or damage becomes known.

9. Confidentiality and Data Protection

9.1 Confidential information must be kept secret; exceptions are information already known, publicly available, or lawfully obtained from third parties.

9.2 Applicable data protection laws (in particular the GDPR) apply. Responsibilities and any required agreements (e.g., data processing agreements) are defined on a project-specific basis.

10. Set-Off and Retention

Set-off and retention are permitted only with undisputed or finally adjudicated counterclaims.

11. Force Majeure

No party is liable for performance disruptions due to force majeure (including outages of public networks/cloud infrastructure, natural events, war, official orders) provided the affected party informs the other without undue delay and takes reasonable measures.

12. Order of Precedence

In the event of conflict, the following order applies: (1) individual offer/service agreement, (2) these GTC, (3) other appendices.

13. Text Form, Governing Law, Venue, Severability

13.1 Text form suffices. Electronic signatures via eIDAS-compliant services satisfy the form requirement. Amendments/supplements and side agreements require text form; this also applies to any waiver thereof.

13.2 German law applies; the UN Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (CISG) is excluded. Exclusive venue is the registered office of uRemoTech GmbH & Co. KG.

13.3 Should individual provisions be invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall not be affected; a provision that comes closest to the economic intent shall apply in place of the invalid provision.

item.title: Are you looking for a new challenge?
item.description:
For our customers

Systemadministrator / IT- Consultant (m/w/d)

IT-Consultants

– Currently no open positions –

Sales & HR

– Currently no open positions –

 

No suitable position? Then apply directly HERE with your resume

 

Why uRemoTech?


1. remote work as the core of our work philosophy
Remote work is the cornerstone of our corporate structure, which we have deliberately chosen! We are convinced that flexible working hours and remote work promote and support the ideal balance between work and family.

2. with us you work on varied projects
You will work on challenging and diverse projects so that you can constantly develop and apply your expertise to different and exciting clients. This ensures that you continue to develop.

3. We live an open corporate culture
We value feedback, foster a culture of open communication and live in an atmosphere where constructive feedback is valued and encouraged. This approach, which focuses on transparency, inclusiveness and adaptability, means that we encourage the emergence of new ideas and are constantly evolving as a result.

4. we strive for technological excellence \
Our heart beats for innovation and technological excellence. Together with you, we develop high-quality and innovative solutions. We work with the latest tools to enable this technical excellence for our customers.

5. we offer you individual career development
In order to offer the best performance, it is important to develop and train yourself further. We encourage and challenge you so that you can grow into new challenges and take on more responsibility. We offer you individual development opportunities, training and further education to help you take the next step in your career.

6. sustainability through remote work
As a pioneering company that works remotely for the most part, we are proud to support sustainability in addition to technological excellence, because our working model significantly reduces the daily commute and makes a major contribution to our ecological footprint.

item.title: Mission & Vision
item.description:
Mission

Win-Win - Your success is our success.

Our mission is to lead your project to success with the help of our best experts at the highest level. We are here to stimulate your growth, identify and unleash untapped potential and enable you to react faster to changing market developments. Our passion for technological excellence drives our success. Many small, medium and large companies already value our commitment and expertise.

Our goal is to help you navigate the technological landscape and pave the way for your sustainable success.

Vision

What once started small is set to become really big in the next 10 years! We want to set a new benchmark in the market and give all companies out there the opportunity to use their full digital potential in a customized way. We work every day to become the most modern, innovative and fastest-growing IT consultancy, unrivaled in progress and technological excellence.

item.title: Our History
item.description:
I myself was employed as an IT consultant. I implemented projects for customers and advised them. I kept asking myself the question: Why do we always do it the same way? There’s a much more efficient way! I had a vision and a goal: my aim is to reinterpret the world of IT consulting in order to change the status quo.

I wanted to make processes more efficient, be freer in the execution of my work, give customers an even better experience and work with people who pursue the same goals as I do.

This is exactly why I founded uRemoTech. A place where customers not only receive the best advice, but also find individual, practical solutions for their specific challenges. At the same time, uRemoTech offers employees the opportunity to take on responsibility, to continuously develop themselves and to harmoniously combine their professional and private lives. No more hour-long commutes, instead efficient working from home - supported by the latest technologies.

Today, the name uRemoTech proudly stands for the 3 fundamental pillars of the company:

u (you) stands for you:

You are the center of attention! As an employee or customer for our service-oriented approach.

Remo (Remote):

Symbolizes our 100% remote approach that we not only live, but also promote. This approach enables our team members to realize a flexible combination of private life and work in today’s digital age and thus creates an innovative way of working together.

Tech (technology):

Tech symbolizes innovation. It is progress not only for us, but for everything in life and we are a part of it. Our focus is on the adept use of state-of-the-art technology to achieve technological excellence. Always with the aim of taking our customers to the next evolutionary stage of digitalization.

With the founding of uRemoTech, the I became a we.
I am proud of my growing team that shares these values! Today, we are joined by more and more like-minded people who believe in our vision, live it every day and drive it forward.

Lennart Röder, CEO

item.title: Our References
item.description: Our expertise is reflected in successful partnerships with renowned customers from a wide range of industries. From large corporations to innovative SMEs - we rely on trusting cooperation and tailor-made solutions that impress.

item.title: Our Values
item.description:
1. Passion

Motivation gives us the impetus to take the first step. Consistency is the key to achieving our goals. We are dedicated and passionate about both our customers and our own team. We are prepared to go the extra mile to promote growth - not only for our customers, but also in our own company.

2. Achieving more together

Strong individuals make up our team. We believe that the synergies created through teamwork allow us to not only hit the target, but to go far beyond it. At our company, we know that teamwork is crucial to our success. Each team member contributes unique talents and skills that strengthen our community.

3. Continuous growth

For us, continuous personal and professional development is the lifeblood of the current and future success of the individual, the team and therefore the entire company. We promote the continuous and ongoing development of all our employees through tailored offers and individual career planning. We believe that the growth of uRemoTech is directly proportional to the growth of each of our employees.

4. Freedom and flexibility

Combining work with friends and family is the most important aspect of a modern world. We work a lot, we like to work. But besides work, there are many other things that are important in life. That’s why we have created a 100% remote working approach and flexible working hours so that you can combine work and private life. This is exactly how we create a completely different way of working and have the best team, regardless of the location of the individual employee.

5. personal responsibility & cooperative leadership

We want all our employees to actively participate in the development of the company by making their contribution conscientiously and responsibly. Our collaborative leadership style encourages individuals to make responsible strategic decisions for the benefit and progress of uRemoTech.
